intro: Cybianthus candamoensis, commonly known as the Canary Island dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and coastal areas, adapting to the arid and saline conditions of its habitat. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in Mediterranean and oceanic climates.
